```markdown
- [Osseni94/keyneg-mcp](https://github.com/Osseni94/keyneg-mcp) üêç üè† - Enterprise-grade sentiment analysis with 95+ labels, keyword extraction, and batch processing for AI agents
```

### PR Title:
```
Add keyneg-mcp: Sentiment analysis MCP server
```

### PR Description:
```markdown
## What does this server do?

KeyNeg MCP Server provides sentiment analysis capabilities for AI agents. It's the first general-purpose sentiment analysis tool for the MCP ecosystem.

**Features:**
- 95+ negative sentiment labels
- Keyword extraction
- Batch processing
- Tiered access (Free/Trial/Pro/Enterprise)
- Offline capable (no external API calls)
- Rust-powered inference via ONNX Runtime

**Use cases:**
- Customer support ticket triage
- Content moderation
- Employee feedback analysis
- Market research
- Social listening

**Links:**
- PyPI: https://pypi.org/project/keyneg-mcp/
- Docs: https://grandnasser.com/docs/keyneg-mcp
```

Enterprise-grade sentiment analysis for AI agents. Extract 95+ negative sentiment labels and keywords from text. Features tiered access, offline capability, and Rust-powered ONNX inference.

**Language:** Python

## Steps to Submit

### awesome-mcp-servers:
1. Fork https://github.com/punkpeye/awesome-mcp-servers
2. Create branch `add-keyneg-mcp`
3. Edit README.md, add entry under appropriate category
4. Commit and create PR

### mcpservers.org:
1. Go to https://mcpservers.org
2. Look for "Submit" or "Add Server" option
3. Fill in the form with details above
